questions.question: What is the most common cause of blindness in India?

As part of a public outreach initiative under the National Programme for Control of Blindnessand Visual Impairment, you are screening the population of a neighboring village. Whilepreparing your report, what definition of blindness would you use?

options.A: Presenting distance visual acuity less than 3/60 in the better eye
options.B: Presenting distance visual acuity less than 1/60 in the better eye
options.C: Presenting distance visual acuity less than 6/60 in the better eye
options.D: Presenting distance visual acuity less than 2/60 in the better eye

questions.explanation: The definition of blindness under the National Programme for Control of Blindness and VisualImpairment (NPCBVI) is presenting distance visual acuity of less than 3/60 in the better eye andlimitation of the field of vision to less than 10 degrees from the center of fixation.

questions.question: Which is the most common cause of preventable childhood blindness?
questions.explanation: The most common cause of preventable childhood blindness is vitamin A deficiency.The most common cause of blindness (including adults), is however, cataract.603

questions.question: You have examined five patients(i-v) in the OPD this morning. Their visual acuity test resultsare as given below. Who amongst them would be described as blind as per the WHO Vision2020 definition?599
questions.explanation: Patients iii and iv would be classified as blind.In the Vision 2020 initiative, the WHO has revised its definition of blindness. As per the newdefinition,"Blindness is defined as a presenting visual acuity of worse than 3/60 or a corresponding visualfield loss to less than 10° in the better eye.'"Note: Blindness is defined for the better eye, hence option (i) is insufficient information to classifyas blind, as information about the better eye is not given.

questions.question: You are appointed as the regional doctor in charge of overseeing the activities underRashtriya Bal Swasthya Karyakram (RBSK). All of the following diseases are specificallycovered under the purview of this program except?
questions.explanation: Congenital glaucoma is not covered under Rashtriya Bal Swasthya Karyakram (RBSK)Child health screening and early intervention services under RBSK envisages to cover 30 selectedhealth conditions for screening, early detection, and free management in the age group birth to 18years. The eye conditions that are covered are• Vitamin A deficiency•Congenital cataract• Vision impairment• Retinopathy of prematurity606
